security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only workflow guidance for unit test creation. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution within the skill itself.

content.user_title: Create Unit Tests for Android Projects
content.value_statement: Writing unit tests ensures code correctness and prevents regressions. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for creating tests that follow project conventions, use Robolectric for Android components, and maintain consistent naming and location patterns.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes source code to identify test cases including happy path, error cases, and edge cases
Sets up test files with correct naming conventions and directory locations
Implements tests using Arrange-Act-Assert pattern with descriptive method names
Runs tests using Gradle commands and interprets test results
Diagnoses and fixes test failures using XML error reports
Guides on using Robolectric for Android component testing
limitations: Does not write actual test code - provides guidance to the AI agent
Does not execute tests directly - requires manual Gradle command execution
Does not modify source code or fix implementation bugs
Focuses on unit tests, not integration or end-to-end tests

best_practices: Always use Robolectric for Android component tests to ensure consistent behavior across devices
Create Fakes instead of Mocks when possible for simpler, more maintainable tests
Run `./gradlew testDebugUnitTest` before committing to catch failures early
anti_patterns: Writing tests without first analyzing the source code behavior
Placing tests in androidTest instead of test source sets for unit tests
Using Mocks when simpler Fakes would achieve the same test coverage

faq.question: What testing framework does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill works with JUnit and Robolectric for Android components. Gradle handles test execution.

faq.question: Can this skill test iOS or web projects?
faq.answer: No. This skill is specifically designed for Android projects using Gradle and Robolectric.

faq.question: How do I run the tests created by this skill?
faq.answer: Use the command `./gradlew :module:testDebugUnitTest` to execute tests for a specific module.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my source code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides guidance for creating test files. It does not modify existing source code.

faq.question: What should I do if a test fails after running?
faq.answer: Check the XML report in build/test-results/testDebugUnitTest/ for detailed error information and stack traces.

faq.question: How is this skill different from using Claude Code directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured guidance specific to Android unit testing conventions, Robolectric usage, and project naming patterns.
